content.description: The antibiotic blasticidin S is a large molecule that can inhibit protein synthesis in mammalian cells. A researcher is investigating how blasticidin S enters mammalian cells. The researcher identified two proteins that might be associated with blasticidin S transport into the cell.
content.question: Which of the following claims most likely explains how the two proteins are directly involved in the antibioticâ€™s ability to enter the cell?

choices.label: They form a receptor complex that selectively binds to blasticidin S in the cell cytoplasm.
They are regulatory proteins that control the expression of other proteins involved in antibiotic transport.
They are transport proteins that facilitate the movement of blasticidin S across the cell membrane.
They are enzymes that chemically modify blasticidin S to make it more soluble inside the cell.

content.answer: They are transport proteins that facilitate the movement of blasticidin S across the cell membrane.
